snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon’s announcement allows him to activate the Missouri National Guard in preparation for a grand jury decision on whether to indict a white police officer for shooting to death an unarmed black teenager.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon declares state of emergency, allowing him to activate National Guard in preparation for unrest that could stem from grand jury decision on whether to indict white police officer Darren Wilson for fatal shooting of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown in Ferguson in August.

byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon’s announcement allows him to activate the Missouri National Guard in preparation for a grand jury decision on whether to indict a white police officer for shooting to death an unarmed black teenager.

headline.main: State of Emergency Declared in Missouri for Grand Jury’s Decision on Ferguson
headline.print_headline: State of Emergency Declared in Missouri for Grand Jury’s Decision on Ferguson
